perturbation.original_text:
“Confidential Information” means all information of Disclosing Party that is disclosed orally or in writing by Disclosing Party to Receiving Party that, at the time of disclosure, is designated as confidential (or like designation), is disclosed in circumstances of confidence, would be understood by the parties, exercising reasonable business judgment, to be confidential, or is not generally known to the public, whether of a business, technical, or other nature, and including, without limitation, designs, plans, drawings, know-how, recipes, and marketing and business plans. Upon
the expiration or earlier termination of this Agreement, Receiving Party shall return to Disclosing Party all of Disclosing Party’s Confidential
Information or shall destroy the same at the option of Disclosing Party. The provisions of this Section 7 shall survive termination or expiration of
this Agreement. The obligations in this Section 7 regarding trade secrets, in particular, will continue for so long as the information constitutes a
trade secret under applicable law. If an unauthorized use or disclosure of a Disclosing Party’s Confidential Information occurs, the Receiving Party
shall promptly notify the Disclosing Party, and the Disclosing Party may take, at the Receiving Party’s expense, all steps which are necessary to
recover Confidential Information disclosed or used in breach of this Agreement and to prevent its subsequent unauthorized use or dissemination,
including availing itself of actions for seizure and injunctive relief.
perturbation.changed_text:
“Confidential Information” means all information of Disclosing Party that is disclosed orally or in writing by Disclosing Party to Receiving Party that, at the time of disclosure, is designated as confidential (or like designation), is disclosed in circumstances of confidence, would be understood by the parties, exercising reasonable business judgment, to be confidential, or is not generally known to the public, whether of a business, technical, or other nature, and including, without limitation, designs, plans, drawings, know-how, recipes, and marketing and business plans. Upon
the expiration or earlier termination of this Agreement, Receiving Party shall return to Disclosing Party all of Disclosing Party’s Confidential
Information or shall destroy the same at the option of Disclosing Party. The provisions of this Section 7 shall not survive termination or expiration of
this Agreement. The obligations in this Section 7 regarding trade secrets, in particular, will not continue for so long as the information constitutes a
trade secret under applicable law. If an unauthorized use or disclosure of a Disclosing Party’s Confidential Information occurs, the Receiving Party
shall promptly notify the Disclosing Party, and the Disclosing Party may take, at the Receiving Party’s expense, all steps which are necessary to
recover Confidential Information disclosed or used in breach of this Agreement and to prevent its subsequent unauthorized use or dissemination,
including availing itself of actions for seizure and injunctive relief.
perturbation.explanation: By stating that the confidentiality obligations, specifically regarding trade secrets, do not survive the termination of the agreement, the contract directly contradicts established trade secret law (Uniform Trade Secrets Act adopted in many states including New York, the governing law identified in section 14), which protects trade secrets indefinitely as long as they remain secret and provide a competitive advantage. Limiting the protection of trade secrets to the term of the agreement is a legal contradiction, rendering the confidentiality provisions regarding trade secrets unenforceable after the contract ends.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Uniform Trade Secrets Act, New York law
